N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 14 ยง 577.5 - Financial reports

State Regulations
(a) Each hospital
shall maintain records, and shall prepare and submit to the commissioner
financial and statistical reports in accordance with the requirements of the
commissioner. (b) All reports
required to be prepared and submitted to the commissioner: (1)
shall be prepared in accordance with
generally accepted accounting principles, unless otherwise required by the
commissioner; (2)
shall be
certified by an officer or administrator of the hospital; and
(3)
shall be subject to audit pursuant to
section
577.6
of this Part. (c) Reports required to be
submitted by subdivision (a) of this section shall be submitted within 120 days
after the close of the hospital fiscal year. (d) If a hospital fails to file the required
reports on the date such reports are due, or fails to file corrected or
additional reports within 30 days after notification by the commissioner that
reports filed by the hospital were inaccurate, incomplete or incorrect, the
commissioner may withhold payments to the hospital for a period beginning on
the first day of the calendar month in which the required reports were due and
continuing until the last day of the calendar month in which the required
reports are filed. (e) Each new
hospital which has no previous cost experience or operating experience shall
prepare and submit to the commissioner financial and statistical information in
accordance with the requirements of the commissioner. Such reports shall
include: (1)
A budget report is required to
be prepared and submitted to the commissioner. Such report shall include: (i) a detailed financial plan, revenues and
expenses and if requested by the commissioner, a line item budget with regard
to staffing, personnel and detailed nonpersonal service costs including
capital; and
(ii)
a detailed
phase-in plan of routine and ancillary services, staffing levels and
utilization by major program areas. (2)

Such budget report shall be compiled and
submitted 90 days prior to the issuance of an operating certificate and shall
cover the first 12 months of operation, unless otherwise specified by the
commissioner. (f) If
information contained in reports filed with the commissioner is inaccurate, incomplete or incorrect, the hospital shall immediately file with the
commissioner corrected reports which comply with the requirements of
subdivision (b) of this section. Notes
